SENT.plain: The bone marrow smears of 18 confirmed cases of MDS were analyzed carefully for the presence of "hypergranular type III blasts", defined as more than 20 fine azurophil primary granules per cells
The concordance was close to 80% among 5 observers
Thirty-nine percent (7 cases) were reclassified as RAEB-t rather than RAEB
The presence of these hypergranular blasts was not suggestive of increased differentiation but rather leukemic cells

The reassignment of cases altered the median survival for the various subcategories, providing a clearer separation with the introduction of type III blasts than without utilizing these cells which were separated from the promyelocyte family
The introduction of this new blast cell definition in a larger series of patients is recommended to confirm these preliminary observations
